original_solution_mapping.L2: 1 hour is 60 mins. So his 1 hour and 45 min podcast is 60+45 = <<1*60+45=105>>105 minutes long

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2179.
    Returns: the number of additional hours the next podcast needs to be.
    """
    # L1
    first_podcast_minutes = 45 # The first podcast was 45 minutes long
    twice_factor = 2 # twice as long as that
    second_podcast_minutes = twice_factor * first_podcast_minutes

    # L2
    third_podcast_hours = 1 # 1 hour and 45 minutes long
    third_podcast_minutes_extra = 45 # 1 hour and 45 minutes long
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # 1 hour is 60 mins
    third_podcast_total_minutes = third_podcast_hours * minutes_per_hour + third_podcast_minutes_extra

    # L3
    fourth_podcast_minutes = 60 # His fourth podcast is 1 hour long
    total_downloaded_minutes = first_podcast_minutes + second_podcast_minutes + third_podcast_total_minutes + fourth_podcast_minutes

    # L4
    total_downloaded_hours = total_downloaded_minutes / minutes_per_hour

    # L5
    total_drive_hours = 6 # a 6-hour drive planned out
    additional_hours_needed = total_drive_hours - total_downloaded_hours

    # FA
    answer = additional_hours_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The second podcast was twice as long as the first so {twice_factor}*{first_podcast_minutes} = <<{twice_factor}*{first_podcast_minutes}={second_podcast_minutes}>>{second_podcast_minutes}

1 hour is {minutes_per_hour} mins. So his {third_podcast_hours} hour and {third_podcast_minutes_extra} min podcast is {third_podcast_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}+{third_podcast_minutes_extra} = <<{third_podcast_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}+{third_podcast_minutes_extra}={third_podcast_total_minutes}>>{third_podcast_total_minutes} minutes long

So far he has downloaded {first_podcast_minutes}+{second_podcast_minutes}+{third_podcast_total_minutes}+{fourth_podcast_minutes} = <<{first_podcast_minutes}+{second_podcast_minutes}+{third_podcast_total_minutes}+{fourth_podcast_minutes}={total_downloaded_minutes}>>{total_downloaded_minutes} min

If he converts {total_downloaded_minutes} min to hours then he has {total_downloaded_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_downloaded_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_downloaded_hours}>>{total_downloaded_hours} hours of podcasts downloaded

He has {total_downloaded_hours} hours of podcasts and his drive is {total_drive_hours} hours so he will need {total_drive_hours} - {total_downloaded_hours} = <<{total_drive_hours}-{total_downloaded_hours}={additional_hours_needed}>>{additional_hours_needed} more hour of podcasts
